36617656.review:
Man oh man, what can I even say? Oh, I know! This game is glorius.

I remember when I first played this game, which was around the time it came out. I loved it then, and I love it now. Now, the first time I played this, it wasn't on steam, but rather a mobile game. I never thought much about mobile gaming, but quell changed that forever. 

The game stuck with me for years after I played it first. So one day I remember this game. I decide "I'm gonna see if this game is on Steam now that I'm a big boy." But what do I end up finding? I find the game, as well as three sequels which I didn't even know existed. I bought them all without hesitation.

The game is visually enticing, has fun, interesting and clever gameplay, and a god-tier soundtrack (which is undoubtedly the reason the game is so memorable to me). I don't really know what to say in terms of replayability, but I still love this game all the same. It's a good good game for all types of players, professional or casual. The game has a decent length for what it is, it has responsive controls and several ways to carry out said controls, and really is just a good game all around.

In short, I adore this game and it is definitely one of my favorites of all time.

Oh, the sequels are pretty good too. Reflect is definitley the best as far as the sequels go, but you can't beat the original.

35543666.review:
This is a decent, quite forgiving movement puzzle game.

It offers 84 levels of increasing difficulty. New mechanics are introduced once in a while, including wrapping around the edge of the screen, turnable spikes, activated one-way blocks, blocks that dissolve when combined and teleporters. You have to collect all pearls to advance to the next level.

Quell is certainly not ground-breakingly innovative, but it's a solid puzzle game that requires some planning-ahead if you want to achieve perfect scores. While you can't skip levels, there is a built-in system of getting hints and solutions for levels, so you never get stuck or overly frustrated. I'll admit, I used the solver on 3 or 4 of the more complex levels just to spare me the annoyance. You can also always undo moves, which I was quite happy about.

On the technical side I was very positively surprised. The mobile origins only show in some of the menu interactions. Otherwise you can completely rely on keyboard and use the very sensible hotkeys. You can tell some thought went into the PC version, it's definitely not one of those awful, lazy mobile ports.

~5-6 hours with little replay value, basic graphics, basic puzzle mechanics - it's a decent way to pass your time, but after a dozen levels I usually took a break because I was already bored. While it may or may not be worth full retail price, I can definitely recommend picking it up on sale or as part of the collection with the two sequels if you like these kinds of puzzle games.

34676286.review: Interesting puzzles, with a surprising depth of mechanics. The interface is intuitive and polished. The music is relaxing. A wonderful casual puzzle game.

33795160.review:
I'm recommending "Quell," but I do have some issues with it.  Mechanics-wise, it's easy to do:  move a raindrop left, right, up or down, find a hidden jewel and cross over some number of pearls in the level.  Broadly speaking, most of the maps are interesting, fun, and satisfying.  Unfortunately, some of the maps (and these tend to be in the last era of them) get so complex that it gets frustrating (and I had to resort to walk-throughs).  Of course, this is a puzzle game and, I suppose, puzzles might involve frustration at some point.  More specific issues are:

- The goal of finding the hidden jewels isn't mentioned in the tutorial.  It doesn't even show up as a bulletin at the top of the screen until you've finished several levels (no problem going back and finding them, though).
- There's a secret level that's so secret there's no Achievement for it or even any indication that it might exist.
- Because the jewel could be hidden anywhere, finding it is usually much harder than solving the puzzle (i.e., picking up the pearls) and basically involves trying to break every block or activate every green dot you can get to.
- Those green dots are a pain.  When you traverse them, they expand into a blockage.  That means the puzzle changes shape every time you go over one and could change shape differently depending on which direction you traverse it (because of multiple green dots in a line).  Usually, that's not too bad.  But, there are several puzzles where there are just oodles of green dots and there's just no way to keep it all straight.
- And, most confusing of all are the walls.  Unless they're blocked, you translate to the opposite wall if you hit one.  The problem is when there are multiple sets of walls:  you're uncertain as to which set of walls you'll translate to.  Again, this is especially bothersome in the final era of maps.

Again, I am recommending the game.  I got 10.9 hours of usually fun game play out of it and it lists for about $4.  So, it's definitely worth it.  I just wish a couple of the maps hadn't been so frustrating.

28414645.review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut.

Spiele mit einer simplen Spielidee (wie hier der Fall) haben ein gewisser Risiko, eher belanglos als spannend zu sein. Das ist natürlich auch Geschmackssache.

Mir gefällt die Spielidee sehr gut. Die Idee ist eine Variante des Brettspiels Rasende Roboter. Man muss (möglichst in so wenig Zügen wie möglich) mit seiner Figur (hier ein wunderschön animierter Wassertropfen) gewisse Felder auf dem Spielfeld erreichen.

Die ersten (bei mir so ca. 40) Level sind ziemlich einfach (etwas zu einfach). Dann wird es langsam schwieriger, so dass es zumindest manchmal nicht einfach wird, nur die minimale Anzahl an Zügen zu benötigen. Einige Level finde ich durchaus anspruchsvoll, besonders wenn man sie perfekt lösen will. Es bleiben mir also noch ein paar Nüsse zu knacken.

Man kann auch Level überspingen oder sich Hinweise geben lassen. Ich habe es (noch) nicht genutzt, aber es ist ja gut, wenn es so etwas gibt.

Ich fand das Leveldesign sehr gelungen. Jeder Level war deutlich anders und so kam keine Langeweile auf.

Die Steuerung ist komfortabel mit Undo- und Reset-Funktion. Man kann genausogut mit Controller wie mit Tastatur und Maus steuern.

Die Grafik ist sehr schön und stilvoll. Die fernöstlich meditativ angehauchte Musik ist angemessen und lenkt nicht ab.

Pro & Contra:

+ Sehr schöne, simple aber unterhaltsame Spielidee
+ Einige anspruchsvolle Level
+ Undo-Funktion
+ Gutes Design

o Anfangs viele sehr leichte Level

Wertung: 10/10

Dieses Spiel hat mir viel Rätselspaß gegeben.

25053090.review:
[b]You might like if:[/b] You want a laid-back, soothing puzzler to wind down with and enjoy.

First installment of the zen-tastic Quell series. They are basically the embodiment of relaxing puzzle games. Guiding a raindrop around a board to an artistic backdrop and gorgeous classical music from Steven Cravis

The catch is that, when moved, the raindrop won't stop until it hits a wall. For such an unassuming concept, the mechanics are superly executed and the different block types add a fun level of variety and challenge. What's particularly nice is that each level has a few challenges: Not only is it about solving it, but you can also do so in a 'perfect' number of moves. Additionally, every level has a jewel hidden within it (normally behind a block) which you have to go out of your way to find. It's a nice mix that gives you plenty to do. The levels are challenging but not brutal, and you're not punished for mistakes or time. All in all, it makes for a very relaxing, but enjoyable game to hop in and out of.

Only thing I'd say: Definitely play this Quell game first. If you've cut your teeth on the sequels, then you'll likely find you blast through most of it a bit too quickly (the last few shelves are still nice and tricky though).

24882959.review: Interesting puzzle game with simple controls and mechanics. Each level has an optimal way of completion as well as a hidden gem to uncover, giving players multiple goals for each puzzle. Difficulty increases steadily and is never unfair.

24635609.review: BGM不错，后面的关卡有难度。

24621777.review: Very relaxing and no pressure. Makes you think but doesn't punish you when you make a mistake. I suffer from frequent headaches and this is easy on the eyes, ears, and brain. Yet you're still using your head to figure out each set of puzzles. I bought all three Quell's and already love this one. Can't wait to try the other two Quell's. The music is nice and goes well with the 'game'. No other game like this on Steam as far as I know. It's a puzzle game which progresses slowly. And let's you 'retry' if you'd like to see if you can do a set with less moves. You control this drop of water with more and more rules being applied as you progress. If you need a game where you can toss it into the category of meditation, this one may qualify. It gently engrosses you and keeps you focused and your mind is still getting a work out. I would imagine this would also be a good brain game for those wanting to keep their minds sharp.

24613212.review:
quell is a very relaxing puzzle game where you control a raindrop and try to collect all the pearls by bumping from wall to wall. it has all the quality of life options and features (windowed mode, volume sliders, save files, multiple profiles, instantaneous level reset, undo, etc.), a great soundtrack and a variety of ways to play. if you only want to go through the 84 levels quickly, you can do that, you can even use coins you collect to unlock levels apart from the very next one, but you can also go for the least possible moves for extra challenge, satisfaction and coins, and try to find the jewel hidden on each level.

there are only 3 minor things I can hold against it: you can't rebind the controls (it plays fine with the keyboard but I would've preferred undo on backspace instead of 'u'), the stage select screen is not very informative, too much clicking/waiting to see which levels aren't perfect or have jewels left to find, and finally the story. there's supposed to be one, it's probably about war and love and whatnot, but it's so subtle it practically doesn't exist. not a huge deal for a puzzle game though.

all in all, great stuff, worth picking up with the other two, reflect and memento, in a bundle to save some money. there's also a 4th game now (quell zen), sold separately.

24528990.review:
コラムスを髣髴させる宝石的な美しさのある落ち着いた雰囲気のパズルゲームです。基本的なルールはこんな感じ↓
・自キャラである青いボールを上下左右に動かして白●を全回収すればクリア
・動かしたボールはブロックその他の破壊(通過)できない何かに当たるまで止まらない
・白●に当たっても止まらない
・外壁に接してて何もないマスは上下左右それぞれの反対側と繋がってる(要は反対側へワープする)
・金のリングはワープゾーン。ワープゾーンから出た後も同じ方向に進み続ける(移動のベクトルが維持される)
・緑●は1回だけ通過可能。通過後は破壊(通過)不可の緑●×9に変化する
・赤いトゲに当たると死ぬ。トゲ以外の方向からはブロックと同じ扱い
※参考画像↓
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=710310989
この手のパズルゲームである以上、テキトーに動かしてクリア…というのは品がなく、「極力動かさずにある程度正解を予測して最小の手数でクリアできる余地があるか否か」は大事な問題だと思います。その点セールで一緒に買ったTransPlan↓
http://store.steampowered.com/app/374410
は複雑で、パズルゲームが(も)苦手なへっぽこゲーマーとしては難易度が高過ぎると感じたんですが、このゲームはその辺りのバランスが適度でした。ただし、そうは言っても歯ごたえがないわけではなく、パズルゲームが苦手なプレイヤー、パズルゲーム好きのプレイヤー、どちらでも楽しめる優れたゲームであるとオススメできます。
ちなみにQuell、Quell Reflect、Quell Mementoの3作がセットになったQuell Collection↓
http://store.steampowered.com/sub/66682/
を買いました。それぞれの満足度の高さも理由ではあるんですが、行き詰った時の気分転換になるという意味でもセットでの購入がオススメです。

各シリーズのスクリーンショット↓を上げてありますのでよろしければ参考にどうぞ(･∀･)

24434350.review:
[h1]Quell —— 水滴解谜 [/h1]
轻松舒适的解谜游戏

24384814.review:
[h1]"The Quell of new puzzles"[/h1]
The Quell collection is a triplet of decent challenging puzzle games. I recommend to buy all three parts in a bundle on sale. Basically you shift orbs throught logical buildup labrinths to collect all pearls with a limit of moves. In higher levels there are added some elements like poisoned orbs, spikes or portals. You can also get stuck in infinite loops. Each level contains a hidden jewel you must find in a second playthrough. The controls are sometimes buggy viewing the game is made for touchpad but it uses mouse pointer swipe instead of arrow keys. So you can accidently do a double move.

Quell Part1 is a good introduction into the series. Altogether 84 puzzles stacked by year numbers (?)  7 years x 3 blocks a 4 puzzles.

24368536.review: 最后几关好难啊...确实是很需要动脑筋的小游戏，全成就达成！

24099753.review:
[h1] ヒーリング系のBGMとアートスタイルがいい味を出しているパズルゲーム [/h1]

個人的には雰囲気やBGMがよくよかったです。

[h1] ゲーム内容 [/h1]

パズルは単純で青色の球を動かしてパール(白い球)を取るだけです、移動すると物にぶつかるまで止まれませんそれを踏まえて、うまくパールを集めていきます、罠や特殊な地形なども多少あります、隠しコレクションアイテムなどもあります。

序盤は何も考えずにクリアできますが、徐々に複雑なマップや地形やらになってきて難しくなってきますが、コイン(ヒントが見れるアイテム)で答えなどもわかるので積むことは多分ないとは思いますが、コインは特定の条件で増えていきます(必要最小限の動きでクリアなど)なので簡単な序盤はなるべくコインと集めるor温存してどうしてもクリアできないステージで使うほうがいいでしょう。

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想など [/h1]

雰囲気がよく、BGMもいい、パズルもヒントを使えばクリアできなくないので、頭を使いすぎなくて済むので気楽にやれるのがいいと思う。

24083470.review: 还算不错的解谜游戏。音乐听着很舒服，关卡相对来说比较循序渐进，每一关都能获得金币，可以用来提示卡关的环节。有些很无脑，有些关卡真的太复杂了完全木有头绪！成就很好刷，没有刻意刷的情况下就差几个成就了。6块钱夏季特惠买的3款打包，价格超值

23146435.review:
A fine, relaxing puzzle game that is neither too easy, nor too frustrating. Everything can be finished by learning from your mistakes (the U and R keys are your friends); I didn't have to use hints until the last few levels. The developers seem to have taken a lot of pleasure in adding red herrings to incite you to get spiked, it's really good fun. I'll most certainly be playing the rest of the trilogy!

Edit: after finishing the entire trilogy, I'd recommend Quell Memento over the first two games. You can play them in order, but if you only have time (or money) for one, skip directly to Memento.

23130503.review: The artwork, animations and music make this a really relaxing, calming experience.

23111657.review:
《水滴解谜》，解谜类游戏
通过控制水滴，用最少步数，将地图中的珍珠全部收集，并在隐藏方块中找到珠宝。

游戏自带中文，操作简单。解谜要素虽然不多，但也构成了各式的关卡。[spoiler]点击主界面的画还可进入隐藏关卡。[/spoiler]bgm也很好听。

游戏难度较为容易，大多数关多试几次就可以通过，不到4个小时就可以全成就。提示的次数特别多，用于卡关。[spoiler]虽然基本用不到[/spoiler]

总得来说，是款不错的游戏，很适合平时休闲。

23043348.review: An excellent and simple puzzle game with eye-soothing graphics, a fair challenge, and some annoyingly chill music that belongs in antique stores.  It's worth playing on mute.

22494288.review:
For all fans of pure logical puzzles games this is a must-have! Go and buy it NOW!!!

Not yet convinced? Ok, the game has simple rules: slide a drop of water around on a window collecting pearls and avoiding spikes. Sounds simple, right? Indeed, it does starts off with easy chambers, then incorporates a nice learning curve and ends up with mind-boggling puzzles (there are also a couple on the way there ;).  There are
[list]
[*]84 campaign puzzles,
[*]4 secret extra puzzles, and
[*]84 jewels to find.
[/list]
There is one jewel cleverly hidden in each one of the puzzle grids which adds a nice mind-teasing bonus to the game.

It took me around 10 hours to play through the whole game and unlock everything. My advice: buy the title in the Quell Bundle together with Quell Reflect and Quell Memento. Each of these two clones adds simple, yet surprisingly rich new mechanics to the game making it even more fun to play.

So again: if you're are logical puzzle lover GO AND BUY IT NOW!!! :D

22412711.review: Quell is a relaxing puzzle game where you slide pieces around the board to pick up objects. Simple and easy to understand mechanics make this game easy to relax with. Not too difficult unless you are looking for the prefect solution. I would reccomend buying the whole Quell collection.

22355202.review:
磨时间的好游戏
100% Achievements Mark

22325100.review: I love this game ! I have it on my kindle and have played it through many times.  It is deffinalely worth the price !

22309245.review:
This is a great logic game

- The levels are well designed with a difficulty going from easy to hard (but not too hard) levels
- No timer at all
- You can play as as little as you want and continue where you left off or go back to previous levels to complete unfinished objectives
- A few levels are hard to finish but a perfect number of moves but there's no penalty for retrying them (there's even an achievement for that!) so you can be persistent or use coins that you obtain by perfecting levels
- Finding and getting the jewel in every level gives you a different objective
- Not a huge number of puzzles but more than adequate for the price

It's very well done too:
- Graphics, music and sound are nice and polished
- Graphic options work as the should (several fixed resolutions, full screen, windowed mode)
- Music and sounds can be muted separately
- Movement can be controlled with keyboard
- Resetting a level or going to the next one can also be done with keyboard

22202547.review: It's a neat little puzzle game. Gets boring fairly fast though, so be warned. Like there is not much complexity to the puzzles. I am starting the next game soon, so we'll see if that makes it more interesting.

21846160.review:
パズルゲーム。
押すと障害物にぶつかるまで押した方向に進み続ける雨粒を動かして全てのパールを集めるパズルだ。全84ステージ。
シンプルルールかつ難易度上昇バランスが良い。後半のステージは難しいがパーフェクトクリアで手に入るコインを使うことで解法を見ることができるので、パズルが苦手な人でも全ステージクリアはできると思う。落ち着いた雰囲気のアートワークやBGMも良い。
ただ、コレクター要素であるジュエル集めは個人的にただただ面倒で蛇足だと思う。ジュエルのほとんどはブロックなどに隠されておりブロックに雨粒をぶつけて探す必要がある。コインを使うことでジュエルの位置を知ることができるが、ジュエルは別解またはセカンド目標のような扱いで最初から表示されている方が良かった。
シンプルルールでついついあと1ステージ・・・とプレイしたくなる良いパズルだ。パズルが好きならオススメのゲームだと思う。

21841896.review:
[b] Nach 2 Stunden Tropfenschieberei schreibe ich nun mein Review zu "Quell" [/b]

Zur Story lässt sich nicht viel sagen, sie steht nicht im Vordergrund, ist nicht wirklich Teil des Spiels und man kann nur deuten was sie sagen soll. Im Großen und Ganzen geht es aber um das Leben einer unbekannten Person (Personen?) und ihre Schönsten Jahre (denk ich).

Der Fokus des Spiels liegt wirklich auf dem Rätseln und dem Lösen der wirklich beachtlich vielen Level. Man steuert hier einen Tropfen welchen man zwischen Hindernissen bewegen muss. Um ein Level abzuschließen muss man aber alle Punkte eingesammelt haben. Frust kommt hier nur kaum auf. Es gibt eine Hilfsfunktion, welche einem enorm weiterhilft, wenn nötig.

Ein weiterer Punkt welchen man dem Spiel anmerken sollte ist die Ruhe und Gelassenheit, welche von diesem Spiel ausgeht. Die Musik und die restliche Atmosphäre des Spiels kann wirklich entspannen. :)

Insgesamt also ein kurzes und beruhigendes Rätselspiel, welches ich Leuten welche teils auch ziemlich kniffelige Rätsel mögen, empfehlen will.

21837164.review: Woah, I'm really digging this game. It's a simple, clean, well done puzzler with calming classical soundtrack. (The music reminds me of Miyazaki for some reason.) The revard curve is very generous. I played for 12 minutes on the first session and unlocked almost half of the achievements. The fast revards and progression kept me playing and will keep me playing until I complete the game. Highly recommended for a quick braintease.

21807817.review: This is a game where you play as a bubble. You must collect all of the pearls while avoiding all of the obstacles. The music in this puzzler game is so relaxing, so much so that if you get stuck, it is almost impossible to rage because the music is so calming! Great game.

第十八款全成就的游戏。

水滴解谜的第一部。
核心玩法就是控制一颗水滴在指定的步骤内吃掉全部珍珠。

游戏难度适中，每关通过后还会有金币奖励，完成成就也有金币奖励，金币可以购买提示点。金币很充足，所以碰到复杂的关卡请放心使用，我通关后还有一百多个金币。

21067118.review:
[h1]I thoroughly enjoyed this very well done puzzle game which has some some beautiful music.[/h1]

The idea of this is simple and unique, and the implementation is very well done and quite polished.  I thoroughly enjoyed my time in the game and looked forward to the next puzzle, which slowly incorporated new challenges and not just bigger or harder puzzles.

My only mild complaint would be the high number of "minimum moves required" to solve the higher levels.  Puzzles that required 20, 25, or 29 minimum moves was a little more time than I wanted to invest at the time, so I happily chose to use the built-in assistant to reveal the solution..  But if you like good challenges, then that difficulty and length of the higher levels is a bonus.

[h1]Happy to see this well-done game.  8 out of 10.[/h1]

20962263.review:
Relaxing puzzle game that offers bigger challenges the farther you get. Great artistic detail.

I was introduced to the Quell series on the mobile platform first, and the PC experience is worth it.

20794877.review: Un bon petit jeu de puzzle avec une musique relaxante...

20502828.review: Simple puzzle game with a lot of extra challenge for perfectionists or those who like to hunt (optimization challenges for the former, hidden gems in every stage for the latter). Lovely music. The whole series is good, but this is the baseline one you can grasp and go without much complexity.

20333245.review: If you like puzzle games with interesting mechanics and nice chill music you'll like this.

20275271.review: Quell is a puzzle game that is challenging but not nerve-wracking. You move a raindrop around mazes of increasing difficulty levels, avoiding various obstacles, to capture pearls along the way. There's nothing not to like about this game, if you're into brain teasers.

20239489.review:
Quell é mais um daqueles incríveis jogos independentes que encontramos pela Steam. Desenvolvido pela  Fallen Tree Games Ltd do qual já tem ótimos games em seu currículo, a trilogia Quell já virou um dos meus jogos Puzzle prediletos e isso porque ele tem tudo o quê eu procuro em um jogo Puzzle: Simplicidade.

Quell é o primeiro jogo da trilogia que contem os seguintes jogos: Quell Memento, Quell Reflect. Eu estou jogando o primeiro título e me divertindo muito. É um jogo que coloca o jogador pra pensar, mas sem ser algo punitivo ou demasiado complexo. Admito que fiquei preso até o momento em 1 ou 2 puzzles, mas nada que acabe frustrando o jogador já que o jogo te da dicas caso você realmente fique preso em determinado puzzle. Isso facilita aquele jogador mais irritado com jogos e que não quer ficar quebrando a cabeça por longos minutos até resolver determinado Puzzle. Em geral Quell é um jogo equilibrado já que 90% dos Puzzles são de dificuldade mediana, sendo que o jogador vai encontrar um ou outro com uma dificuldade mais acentuada. Ou seja, é o título perfeito para iniciantes no mundo Puzzle e até mesmo veteranos que procuram um jogo deste estilo.

Quell tem uma trilha sonora belíssima e uma arte incrível. Eu diria que são seus pontos de destaque já que no jogo tudo funciona em perfeita harmonia. O cenário é bem construído e a trilha sonora é extremamente relaxante. Ou seja, você pode apreciar o jogo com calma, mesclando com aquele outro título mais frenético que você está jogando na sua Steam. Perfeito para os momentos de procastinação, inclusive.

O objetivo de Quell é guiar uma bola de água (pelo teclado) a coletar objetos pelo cenário em uma determinada quantia de movimentos que são contados na tela. Você coletando todas as pequenas esferas do cenário, você termina aquele Puzzle e vai para o próximo. É claro que tem objetivos extras como por exemplo: Pegar pedras (diamantes) escondidos pelo cenário, concluir o puzzle com o menor número possível de movimentos, desviar de espinhos, pegar portais que levam a outra parte do cenário e mais outras coisas que deixam o jogo um pouco mais complexo, mas sem se tornar frustrante para o jogador e sim tornando ele ainda mais divertido. As conquistas de Quell são absurdamente faceis de conseguir, é claro ... se você quiser respeitar determinados tipos de regras dentro do jogo, como por exemplo: Terminar o puzzle com uma determinada quantidade de movimentos. Mas nada é muito complexo já que se você não tiver paciência é só usar as dicas e você consegue concluir todos os níveis no modo "perfeito". Tudo no jogo até o determinado momento desta análise funciona de maneira exemplar e dinâmica. Os puzzles tem dificuldade ajustada, o cenário é belo, a trilha sonora é relaxante e as conquistas são bem faceis de se conseguir. Quer mais? O jogo conta com o idioma Português e com uma jogabilidade suave e descomplicada.

Algumas recomendações: Compre a trilogia! eu paguei 3,99 na sale de inverno e obtive a trilogia. É claro que se você jogador for comprar fora da fale vai pagar muito mais caro e não sei se valeria a pena já que acredito se tratar de um jogo bem curto. Mas é claro, isso depende de pessoa pra pessoa. Eu como paguei barato nos 3 jogos, estou mais do que satisfeito.

Quell oferece tudo que um jogador de Puzzle iniciante ou expert procura: Boa dose de dificuldade, arte magnífica, trilha sonora relaxante e todinho em Português. Apesar de Quell não oferecer um enredo, isso não diminui a qualidade deste incrível título independente que pode rodar em qualquer computador e que oferece horas de diversão!

Eu recomendo, Quell.

20229469.review:
This game is sometimes challenging but the music and graphics are relaxing and peaceful.  I've seen other similar games but with just basic graphics that are blah.  This game is what a puzzle game should be:  a complete package of good gameplay, graphics and music.  There's no story, but I don't expect that from a puzzle game.

How to Play:

Use your mouse or the arrow keys to move a blue sphere through a maze to collect all the pearls.  Once you choose a direction the sphere keep going until it bumps into something.  Avoid spikes (obviously!), use warp rings (look like sonic rings) and you can even move off the screen and appear at the opposite side!  Though sometimes that leads to endless loop if there is nothing to bump against.

Music:

Soft, peaceful background music that does not intrude on your thought but is just nicely in the background.  Perfect for this game.

Graphics:

You are in a quaint house with lots of brown, beige and neutral colors.  The level select is a bookcase.  When you go to play a level it goes to the window.   I'm very impressed with how much these little details add to the game to make it complete.  It's not "just" a puzzle game, it's a peaceful experience.

There is no timer (yay!).  You can take as many moves as you like to finish a level, but they do say what the least amount of moves is for each level and you can replay to try for that goal.  

There are achievements for those who like to collect 100%.  I have not finished the game, so I can't tell you if they are all easy to get or some really difficult.  I'll have to update this reveiw once I know for sure.

tl:dr version:

Move ball through maze to collect objects in the least number of moves
Peaceful music
Quaint setting
No timer
Achievements

19986354.review:
Very simple yet fun puzzle game. 

Not too many different puzzle elements and they are all introduced early in the game. In a more expensive puzzle game, I would find this to be disappointing, but given the price of this game, it's not a significant issue. 

I appreciated that the more difficult puzzles were clever and not convoluted. The game shows you the optimal number of moves to solve each puzzle, and usually it doesn't take that many moves. 

It looks like the other games in the collection are very similar. Possibly they use the identical puzzle elements, based on the screen shots. In this case I think they probably should have been consided DLC, but given the price of all the games, it doesn't really matter.

19825856.review:
Quell является представителем жанра игр-головоломок (как я часто называю подобные, "логика с пространством"), ничем не уступающая, к примеру, 6180 the moon или micron.
Наткнулся на неё совершенно случайно, но тем приятнее было моё удивление, когда помимо визуального, добротно-оформленного стиля и ненавязчивой композиции, меня затянул игровой процесс, суть которого состоит в собирании всех жемчужин на уровне в условиях ограниченного пространства, движений и препятствий.
Уровни проходятся достаточно легко и непринуждённо, так как в игре нет каких-то жестких ограничений по времени или ходам, но есть так называемый perfect (подразумевает собой минимальное количество передвижений на максимально-быстрое завершение уровня).
На данный момент в Steam находятся три разных Quell. С этих игр можно смело начинать знакомство с жанром головоломок в целом и затем переходить к более сложным представителям в частности, так что очень даже рекомендую посмотреть хотя бы первую часть, может и вас затянет на вечер-другой, как меня.

19720628.review:
Good puzzle game. Starts out really simple and stays pretty simple until the last two years. I never really got stumped or had my brain hurt from the difficulty, but for $1 an hour this game is easily worth the puzzles. You can see the gameplay in the trailer, so no elaboration needed.

Don't understand the necessity of the jewels/gems. There hidden in blocks (usually) that you have to ram your ball in to to get, which is usually out of the way of the objective. I don't really enjoy just redoing the levels to find the random gems by smashing random blocks until i find the one that the gem is in, which is why I just checked the guide to find the damn things after a while. How is it a puzzle if I have to blindly ram blocks? That's just stupid.

The graphics are nice too, but not really necessary for a puzzle game. This could have been accomplished with a 2D black and white game and would have been just as enjoyable. I didn't listen to the music so if you really care about the music of your puzzle games, check some of the other reviews.

Give this a go if you like puzzles, you most likely won't be disappointed. If you are, I told you it was pretty easy till the last two levels.

19691644.review: Quell delivers a soothing puzzle solving experience with its combination of simple gameplay mechanics and mesmerizingly relaxing soundtrack. There is nothing to dislike about it and coincidentally, everything about it is to like. Take the break every now and then with Quell in your body and mind.

19677678.review:
平板移植pc，支持1080p和手柄，而且画面看起来非常舒服，算是移植里面体验很棒的了。

Quell是一款单纯的休闲解谜游戏，玩家要做的就是在富有90世纪年代感的窗口（大概）上控制水滴吃掉关卡中的所有珍珠，每一关还隐藏有一颗宝石，每一关也有完美步数限制，算是比较传统的解谜游戏玩法。

+画面很舒服，音乐更舒服，蛮悦耳的
+关卡元素逐渐增加，难度逐渐提升，但总体来说前面半截不是很难，玩起来确实能休闲到没错……
+自带中文
+成就有35个，而且大部分不难达成，我一个小时拿了24个，要硬刷的话应该是26+个
+完美达成和解锁成就都送金币，金币可以拿来买提示
+我万圣节7块钱买了三部曲

-游戏的画面严格来说是背景画面非常精致，关卡画面是古老的手机解谜游戏feel

总评：一款制作比较精致的传统的解谜游戏，质量不错，但不算惊艳——8/10

19447264.review:
Quell puts a variation on the sokoban game genre. It is an abstract puzzle with sequential-movement solutions, on a grid, which only allows sliding movements. You have to collect all of the 'pearls' in a level to proceed to the next and it challenges you to do it in as few movements as possible. It features mechanics such as matching push blocks, hazardous spikes and levers to rotate them, appearing blocks, which trigger when passed over, teleportation, off-grid movements, hidden jewels collecting. It also comes with background music and although it's only a single continuous loop it works wondrously with the combination of other game sounds to create a relaxing atmosphere. It features a reward system for your correct solutions and any hidden gems that you find throughout the game, which you can then use for hints on more difficult levels. 

Overall, it's a casual game, but still offers a modest challenge and lots of fun elements!

19424292.review:
Wonderful casual game. 

Everything to like, nothing to dislike.

Yes, get.

19307688.review:
★★★★★★★☆☆☆ - 7/10

Quell ist ein entspannender Puzzler der dank eingebautem Guide auch nicht frustrierend wird. 
Insgesamt hat man an 84 Puzzles mehr oder weniger zu knappern.

Großes Lob an den Entwickler, so kompfortabel soll ein Spiel sein:
- Lautstärke und Bilschirmmodus einstellbar
- lokalisiert in mehrere Sprachen
- Controller wird erkannt auch wenn er nach dem Spielstart eingeschaltet wird und das Spiel erkennt auch wenn man im Spiel die Steuerung wechselt.

- Steamerrungenschaften (die auch im Spiel etwas wert sind)

Fehlen eigentlich nur noch für unsere nicht genormten Spieler eine 
konfigurierbare Steuerung (auch wenn die Grundeinstellung perfekt ist) und Steam-Sammelkarten :D

Danke Fallen Tree Games,
hat mir auf dem Smartphone schon gefallen und wurde auf den PC wunderbar portiert.
Freu mich schon auf das nächste eurer Projekte :D

18578675.review:
Si [i][b]Quell[/b][/i] ne résistera pas bien longtemps aux joueurs de puzzle-game les plus acharnés (succès y compris), il possède néanmoins certains atouts : sa musique, franchement excellente, son concept simple, efficace, et surtout son prix modique.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

18049899.review:
Ich würde dem Spiel 3/5 Sternen geben. Ich finde es ganz schön, es ist aber nichts besonderes oder besonders fesselnd.
Ein nettes kleines Spiel.

[url=http://annas-computerspielecke.blogspot.de/2015/09/quell.html] Die ausführliche Review ist hier zu finden [/url]

17898046.review: It's a good puzzle game, easy in the beginning but harder near the end. And you can't be blocked, thanks to the help system. You should try it.

17290590.review:
Nice little puzzle game.
I was looking for a relaxing game, and that's what I found in this one.
It's quite easy to find a solution and a bit more difficult to find the best one.
The music perfectly fits, and so do the graphics, clean and simple.

17065156.review:
[h1]Quell fait parti de The Quell Logic Collection[/h1]

Le point fort de Quell, c’est le nombre de tableaux mais aussi la musique et le graphisme qui sont étonnant beau pour un jeu de réflexion. 

L’objectif du jeu est simple. Vous dirigez une goutte d’eau dans un tableau et vous devez ramasser toutes les perles du tableau. La contrainte, c’est de faire cela en un minimum de déplacement.

Tout le monde dit du bien de ce jeu et c’est normal, il est tout simplement excellent. Et puis, pour le prix, il n’y a aucune raison de se priver et de ne pas l’acheter !

[url=www.graal.fr/2015/05/29/test-the-quell-logic-collection-la-version-pour-steam/]N’hésitez pas à lire toutes mes impressions sur The Quell Logic Collection.[/url]

17023463.review:
直感的な操作と簡単なルールで、すぐに楽しむことができたパズルゲーム。
難易度もそれほど高くないので、誰でも楽しめると思う。（後半はちょっと複雑になってくるけど）

他にシリーズも出ているので、そちらも是非。

17021260.review:
Another great puzzle game for those who like their challenges cerebral.
For me I found it not that hard or difficult.
A sense of logic or commonsense is all that's really needed to play this
successfully.
I put this one in the same great category of other brain games like Hook,
Lyne an Kami.
All of which I have played and enjoyed.
If you played these other games and enjoyed them than I can recommend
that you seriously add this to your collection.

15859808.review: Great game! Easy to learn but not always easy to perfect. Really nice interface. Love the music. If you like Puzzle Logic games..You won't go wrong buying this.

15842154.review:
As a huge fan of puzzle games such as Professor Layton, I came into quell with high expectations, and this game exceeded them. Every level feels clever in its own way and going for perfect levels and a hidden gem in each is a great way to extend the play time of the game. The achivements are really easy to get as well. One issue is that the game could be very short for someone not going for everything, but I think most will fall in love with the game. I highly recommend this game to ANY puzzle fan looking for a challenge on steam. 

My Rating: 8.5/10

15834486.review: I have only gotten 16/35 achievements so far but from what I have played so far it seems like a fun simple puzzle game to play and kill the time. So far a few levels left me saying now how is that a realistic amount of moves for a perfect score on the board but after playing more and going back I figured them out. Worth giving it a play in my opinion if you are a fan of puzzle games. The game is split into 7 "worlds" 3 stages on each with 4 levels per stage. Ive still got a ways to go before completing it, and thats just the first game lol

15827911.review:
Absolutely spectacular game. I’ve been playing it for years on iOS, and the PC version is even more beautiful.

Quell is an amazingly designed and polished puzzle game that starts with a very simple premise. You control a drop of water, and you must move the drop around to collect all of the Pearls in each level, except once you move the drop, it does not stop until it hits a wall. These basic gameplay mechanics make for some very well designed and challenging levels. The game then slowly adds more rules and mechanics to add to the challenge.

This is a game that is definitely worth it any price tag, and I would recommend you pick it up today. Even if you’re not normally into puzzle games, you may be surprised how much you will enjoy Quell.
From its artwork, to its music, to the pure level of polish this game has, it is by far one of the best puzzle games available.

If you’ve played Quell and liked it, check out the two sequel games: Quell Reflect, and Quell Memento, which add even more new mechanics and put a fun twist on an already awesome game.

15826911.review: Okay, I love this after about 30 seconds.  yum

39416768.review: A very fun puzzler.  There's still a challenge to beat the levels, then to try to beat the levels in as few moves as possible, and finally to find the hidden gem on each level.  It's relaxing to play around with the levels trying things out, and it's just a nice, well put together game.  Granted, it is a puzzle game, so if you don't like those to begin with, this one likely won't change your mind, but if you do like puzzle games, this one is certainly one of the better ones.

39323347.review:
생각을 비우기 위해서 하는 느낌이다.

39183557.review:
갓 ㅡ 겜
저는 이 게임 엔딩을 봤습니다
 저처럼 퍼즐을 좋아하는 분들은 재밋게 할 수 있습니다.저는 어렵지 않게 플레이 했던 것 같네요 ^^

39010670.review:
In Quell geht es darum, durch das Verschieben eines Tropfens alle Perlen im jeweiligen Level einzusammeln. Da der Tropfen erst dann seine Bewegung (nach oben, unten, links oder rechts) stoppt, wenn er an ein Hindernis stößt, ist das ganze Unterfangen nicht so einfach und kann schon mal in einer Endlosschleife enden, wenn man den Tropfen unüberlegt über den Rand des Spielfeldes hinaus und auf der gegenüberliegenden Seite wieder hinein schickt, usw. usf.... Man muss sich vorher also genau überlegen, welchen Weg man mit dem Tropfen am besten wählt. Da nach und nach neue Hindernisse dazu kommen, wird das Spiel zunehmend schwieriger, bleibt aber bei einer gewissen Verbissenheit bewältigbar. Man kann zwar durch eine falsche Bewegung ein Level unlösbar machen, aber fairerweise wird man jedes Mal darauf hingewiesen, wenn man etwas unwiderruflich verbockt hat, und kann das Level neu starten. So lernt man schließlich auch dazu. 
Die Grafik und die Musik von Quell gefallen mir nicht besonders, und da es andere Spiele gibt, in die ich meine Lebenszeit noch lieber investiere, werde ich Quell vermutlich nicht zu Ende zocken. Wer ruhige, stratgische Spiele mag, bei denen er, so lange er möchte, jeden einzelnen Zug überlegen darf, der wird damit allerdings seine Freude haben.

39001993.review: Quell is a great puzzler. It's simple enough to play as a relaxing game when you don't want to think too hard, but you'll need to come back and put your mind to it to finish every level with a perfect score.

39597485.review: Satisfying puzzles. Plenty of thought behind level design, some of it is really clever. Most levels are solvable from the start, but sometimes the perfect solution is over 20 moves and I needed some trial and error.

39596371.review:
Spectacular puzzle game. Beautiful design, calming music, and deceptively simple puzzles. Like many of the other reviewers, I too picked this up on mobile a long time ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. I can honestly say I am enjoying it all over again. 

One negative thing which I must add, is why they chose to remove the story from this version? If I am not mistaken, the mobile game told a narrative as you unlocked new stages. This seems to be just the puzzles. This obviously has no impact on the game overall, but still, I do remember enjoying the words of the old man as they usually pertained to the puzzes themselves.

Anyway, for a simple puzzle you can just play to unwind or destress, this is definitely it. I picked up my copy on HumbleBundle for around $1 although $4 is definitely worth the hours of play you will get out of it. Enjoy!

40548668.review: The game's simple mechanics make it easy to learn, but give many possibilities. It's rather easy, but if you'll want to complete every level perfectly, you'll really need to use your brain.

40166653.review: まだ序盤しかしていないですが、普通にすっとできてよいパズルゲー。操作感も、難易度も心地よい。

39844184.review:
这个系列游戏我希望能从steam下架，因为这款游戏的制作者不管是故意的还是无知，都在游戏的语言选择界面体现出了”台独“倾向。
现在支持中文的游戏越来越多，大多数都是支持繁体中文，而且我也注意到，基本所有游戏的语言选项，繁体中文是Chinese Traditional，简体中文是Chinese simplified。
而在这个游戏的语言选择界面，和其他游戏不同，出现了“Taiwanese”这个词，简体中文是chinese，繁体中文是Taiwanese，感觉上就好像简体中文是中国的，繁体中文就不是中国的，而是台湾了，好像是两个国家的文字，这存在很大的歧义和误导。
